pr_title: [HUDI-625] Fixing performance issues around DiskBasedMap & kryo

timeline.message: [HUDI-625] Fixing performance issues around DiskBasedMap & kryo

timeline.bodyText:
I agree that the newInstance() seems like creating a new serializer instance every time if the above conditions are not triggered. And also I think Kyro should be faster than the java default.
What about the user-defined custom payload? Do we need to register it somewhere?
timeline.author: garyli1019

replies.bodyText: Hi @garyli1019, hudi put HoodieRecord to kryo, the payload data inside has been coverted to byte[] data, see BaseAvroPayload#BaseAvroPayload. So It doesn't affect anything if we register payload class.
replies.author: lamberken
garyli1019

replies.bodyText:
Get your point, these serializers are not necessary now.

Custom serializers are need when there are special requirements for serialization and deserialization.
We use InstantiatorStrategy, which is also efficient. kryo-creation [1]
kryo.setInstantiatorStrategy(new DefaultInstantiatorStrategy(new StdInstantiatorStrategy()));


If we do that currently, it will affect many places.

[1] https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo#object-creation
replies.author: lamberken
vinothchandar

timeline.bodyText: The default is FieldSerializer and the description of setIgnoreSyntheticFields is Controls if synthetic fields are serialized. Default is true. So I think this Override might be unnecessary.
timeline.author: garyli1019

timeline.bodyText: I guess, this achieves the same purpose as the code in newInstantiator that you deleted below?
timeline.author: vinothchandar
